source_sentence: 佛說息諍因緣經
translation: Foshuo xiwei genyi jing

source_sentence: 西天譯經三藏朝奉大夫試光祿卿
translation: Minister of Light for the Tripiṭaka Translation of the Sutra of the Western Paradise, the Grand Master of the Chaofeng

source_sentence: 傳法大師賜紫臣施護奉　詔譯
translation: Master Chuanfa Zhichen Shihuofeng Translation of the Imperial Edict

source_sentence: 如是我聞：一時，世尊在舍摩迦子聚落之中，坐夏安居，諸苾芻眾去佛不遠亦各安居。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Bhagavān was sitting in summer retreat in the village of Śāmakāja, and the multitude of monks and nuns who were not far from the Buddha were also sitting in retreat.

source_sentence: 時，有沙門名曰尊那，在惹盧迦林中坐夏安居。
translation: At the time, there was an ascetic named Zunna who was sitting in the forest of Jaloka, retreating for the summer.

source_sentence: 彼有外道尼乾陀惹提子，是極惡者忽爾命終。
translation: There was a layman, Nirgrantha Jātīputra, who was extremely wicked and suddenly died.

source_sentence: 彼尼乾陀有子，欲於沙門而興鬪諍，作如是言：「我之法律唯我自知，非汝所知；汝之法律唯汝自知，亦非我知。
translation: That Nirgrantha had a son who wanted to start a fight with the ascetic and said, "My laws are known only to me, not to you, and your laws are known only to you, not to me.

source_sentence: 我所有法皆悉如理，汝所有法一切非理；和合法是我，不和合法是汝。
translation: All of my laws are completely reasonable, and all of your laws are not reasonable; it's I who are legal and you who are not legal.

source_sentence: 汝諸所說，前言縱是後言即非，後言或是前言即非，諸有語言皆無義利亦無所取，雖廣所說不能解脫，亦不能知最上實義。
translation: Whatever you say, even though the former is true and the latter is not, and even though the latter is true or the former is not, all language has no meaning and nothing to grasp, and even though it's explained in detail, it's not possible to be liberated, nor can you know the supreme true meaning.

source_sentence: 謂沙門所說不同我法，云何能令我起解心？」
translation: How can an ascetic's explanation that differs from my own teachings cause me to become liberated?"

source_sentence: 彼尼乾陀子故作是語起破壞事，欲興鬪諍損減力能，以苦惱緣壞安樂法。
translation: That son of Nirgrantha thus spoke and started something destructive, wanting to start a fight that would diminish his powers and destroy the peaceful Dharma because of the conditions of suffering and distress.

source_sentence: 以是因緣，欲於沙門清白法中起不善業，而興鬪諍種種破壞，生我慢心而謂勝他，乃言：「沙門諸有所說，皆非法律，不正了知、不能出離，於菩提道不能趣向，汝師非是如來、應供、正等正覺。」
translation: Because of this, he wanted to create unwholesome activity among the ascetics' pure dharmas, start a fight that would undermine it in various ways, become proud of himself, and claim superiority over others. He then said, "Ascetics who say anything are not the Dharma, don't correctly understand it and can't escape it, and can't be headed for the path to enlightenment; your teacher is not the Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, or Completely Awakened One."

source_sentence: 爾時尊那沙門坐夏既滿造衣已竟，即離是處，著衣持鉢次第而行，往舍摩迦子聚落之中。
translation: After he had finished making robes for the summer retreat, that venerable ascetic left that place, put on his robe and bowl, and went in order to the village of Śāmakaṭī.

source_sentence: 到已收衣鉢洗足，而詣尊者阿難所，頭面禮足退住一面。
translation: When he arrived, he put away his robe and bowl, washed his feet, went to Venerable Ānanda, paid homage with his head and feet, and withdrew to one side.

source_sentence: 是時尊者阿難問尊那沙門言：「尊那！
translation: Venerable Ānanda then asked the ascetic Zuni, "Zuni!

source_sentence: 汝於何處坐夏安居？
translation: Where did you spend your summer retreat?

source_sentence: 復以何緣而來至此？」
translation: What further reason did it take to come here?"

source_sentence: 尊那白言：「尊者！
translation: Venerable Nārada said, "Venerable!

source_sentence: 我在惡處惹盧迦林中坐夏安居。
translation: I was sitting in a summer retreat in the forest of Jaloka, a bad place.

source_sentence: 彼有外道尼乾陀惹提子，是極惡者忽爾命終。
translation: There was a layman, Nirgrantha Jātī, who was extremely wicked and suddenly died.

source_sentence: 尼乾陀有子，欲於沙門而興鬪諍，乃至彼言，汝師非是如來應供正等正覺。
translation: Nirgrantha has a son who wants to start a fight with the ascetic, and he says, 'Your teacher is not the Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, Perfectly Enlightened.

source_sentence: 我以是緣，故來至此。」
translation: It's for this reason that I've come here."

source_sentence: 阿難告言：「尊那！
translation: Ānanda told him, "Venerable!

source_sentence: 我知是事，以佛世尊不在眾中，故有外道欲興鬪諍。
translation: I know this is the case because the Bhagavān is not among them, and so there are non-Buddhists who want to start a fight.

source_sentence: 而汝今時不得與諍，若起鬪諍即不能利益多人，復令多人生諸苦惱，乃至諸天人眾悉無利益咸生苦惱。
translation: If you start a fight, it won't be able to benefit many people, and it will cause many people to experience suffering and distress, even if none of the gods or humans benefit from it and become distressed.

source_sentence: 如汝尊那所說事等，唯佛世尊而悉知見。
translation: Such things as those explained by your venerable friend, the Bhagavān alone knows and sees them all.

source_sentence: 我今與汝同詣佛所，具陳上事。」
translation: Now, I'll come with you to the Buddha and explain the above things in detail."

source_sentence: 尊那白言：「善哉尊者！
translation: Zonta said, "Good, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 若得見佛我獲大利；又於佛所，或得聽聞甚深正法。」
translation: If I could see the Buddha, I'd be greatly enriched; and at the Buddha's place, I might be able to hear the very profound right teaching."

source_sentence: 時尊者阿難即與尊那沙門同詣佛所，到已各禮佛足退住一面。
translation: Venerable Ānanda then went to the Buddha with that ascetic, and when they arrived, they each bowed their feet to the Buddha and withdrew to one side.

source_sentence: 時尊者阿難前白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Venerable Ānanda then went to the Buddha and said, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 此尊那沙門，在惹盧迦林中坐夏安居。
translation: This venerable Nasrāyaṇa was sitting in the forest of Jaloka during the summer retreat.

source_sentence: 彼有外道尼乾陀惹提子，是極惡者忽爾命終。
translation: There was a layman, Nirgrantha Jātī, who was extremely wicked and suddenly died.

source_sentence: 尼乾陀有子，欲於沙門而興鬪諍，乃至彼言，汝師非是如來、應供、正等正覺。
translation: Nirgrantha has a son who wants to start a fight with the ascetic, and he says, "Your teacher is not the Tathāgata, Worthy of Offerings, or Completely Enlightened.

source_sentence: 以是緣故來語於我。
translation: It's for this reason that he came to me and said.

source_sentence: 世尊！
translation: "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我時謂尊那言：『以佛世尊不在眾中，故有外道欲興鬪諍。
translation: I then said to Bhagavān, 'It's because the Bhagavān is not among them that some outsiders want to start a fight.

source_sentence: 而汝今時不得與諍，若起鬪諍即不能利益多人，復令多人生諸苦惱，乃至諸天人眾悉無利益咸生苦惱。』」
translation: You mustn't fight with them now; if you start a fight, it won't benefit many people and will cause many people to experience suffering and distress, even if none of the gods and humans will benefit from it and become distressed.'"

source_sentence: 佛言阿難：「汝見何緣，乃言：『佛不在眾，有外道輩起鬪諍事。』
translation: The Buddha said to Ānanda, "What reason do you see for saying, 'The Buddha isn't in the congregation, but there are non-Buddhists who want to start a fight.'
What's wrong?"

source_sentence: 阿難白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Ānanda said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我於一時，見二苾芻佛所稱讚。
translation: At one point, I saw two monks praised by the Buddha.

source_sentence: 是二苾芻善持律法，威儀次序在一處行，我時見已乃謂彼言：『汝二苾芻，不應如是現威儀相。
translation: Those two monks well-maintained the vinaya and conducted themselves in a dignified manner in one place, and when I saw them, I said, 'You two monks, you shouldn't behave in a dignified way like that.

source_sentence: 佛不在眾，或有外道，見是相已起鬪諍事。
translation: The Buddha isn't in the congregation, and there might be a non-Buddhist who sees this kind of appearance and starts a fight.

source_sentence: 若鬪諍起，即令多人乃至諸天人眾，悉無利益咸生苦惱。』
translation: If a quarrel arises, it will cause many people, even gods and humans, to experience no benefit and become afflicted.'

source_sentence: 我憶此緣，故為尊那作如是說。」
translation: Remembering this reason, I therefore said this for Venerable Ānanda."

source_sentence: 佛言阿難：「於汝意云何？」
translation: The Buddha said to Ānanda, "What do you think?"

source_sentence: 阿難白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Ānanda said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我於是事不能了知。」
translation: I'm unable to comprehend these things."

source_sentence: 佛言阿難：「我以自智現成正覺，於其中間廣說諸法，謂四念處、四正斷、四神足、五根、五力、七覺支、八正道，如是等法，我所宣說悉知悉見。
translation: The Buddha said to Ānanda, "With my own knowledge, I've now become perfectly enlightened and have explained in detail the four abodes of mindfulness, the four correct eliminations, the four miraculous powers, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven factors of awakening, the eightfold path, and so forth, and I've fully known and seen all of these things as I've explained them.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 多諸外道於苾芻眾而興鬪諍，此鬪諍緣，汝能知不？」
translation: Many non-Buddhists get into fights with the multitude of bhikṣus. Can you understand the object of these fights?"

source_sentence: 阿難白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Ānanda said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我不能知。」
translation: I can't know that."

source_sentence: 佛言阿難：「謂有苾芻，於戒有增或時有減，威儀有增或時有減。
translation: The Buddha said to Ānanda, "Suppose there's a monk who increases or decreases in moral discipline and increases or decreases in manner.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 若戒及威儀有增有減，即失常法；隨所行處，乃有外道，見是事已即起鬪諍。
translation: If there's an increase or decrease in precepts and manner, it's out of the norm, and depending on where they're practiced, there are non-Buddhists who see this and start a fight.

source_sentence: 若鬪諍起，即令多人乃至諸天人眾，無所利益咸生苦惱。
translation: If a fight arises, it will cause many people, even gods and humans, to experience suffering and distress for no benefit.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 諸外道尼乾陀輩，非一切智亦非真實，於一切處一切所見悉不清淨，是故常樂起鬪諍事。
translation: Those non-Buddhists of the Nirgrantha group aren't omniscient and aren't true, and they don't understand everything they see in all places, so they're always happy to start a fight.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 當知諸苾芻眾諍事起時，由有種種鬪諍根本。」
translation: You should know that when disputes arise among the monks and nuns, it's because there are various sources of quarrels."

source_sentence: 阿難白佛言：「善哉世尊！
translation: Ānanda said to the Buddha, "Good, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 善哉善逝！
translation: Bravo, good riddance!

source_sentence: 今正是時，願佛宣說鬪諍根本，令諸苾芻聞已憶持常離過失。」
translation: Now is the right time, may the Buddha explain the root of the quarrel so that the monks who hear it will remember it and always be free of faults."

source_sentence: 佛言阿難：「汝等諦聽！
translation: The Buddha said to Ānanda, "All of you, listen closely!

source_sentence: 如理作意，如善記念，今為汝說。
translation: As you correctly contemplate it, as you well remember it, I'll now explain it for you.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 若有苾芻起忿恨心，由忿恨故，乃於師長不生恭敬尊重等心，亦復不能承事供養；由不恭敬彼師長故，即不見法；以不見法故，於苾芻眾中不正觀察；由不正觀察故，乃興鬪諍；由鬪諍起故，即令多人乃至諸天人眾，悉無利益咸生苦惱。
translation: If a monk becomes angry, then because of that anger, he doesn't respect his teacher and doesn't honor him, and he can't serve or make offerings to him; because he doesn't respect his teacher, he doesn't see the teaching; because he doesn't see the teaching, he doesn't correctly observe it among the monks; because he doesn't correctly observe it, a fight arises; and because a fight arises, it causes many people, even gods and humans, to lack benefit and become afflicted.

source_sentence: 又有苾芻，於內於外悉計為有，作實觀察注意積集，喜為邪惡、極惡作意，勇發邪勤、出邪妄語，引起鬪諍。
translation: Also, there are monks who imagine everything inside and outside to be existent, make true observations, pay attention to accumulate, delight in evil and extremely evil intentions, courageously undertake evil endeavors, and speak wrongly and falsely, which causes quarrels.

source_sentence: 如是妄念不正知，起不相應，乃至於鬪諍緣不能斷滅。
translation: Such false thoughts are not correctly perceived, and they give rise to nonconcomitance, so that the causes of the quarrel can't be stopped.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 如是等事為鬪諍根本，是故生諸苦惱。
translation: Such things are the root of a fight, which gives rise to suffering and distress.

source_sentence: 苦惱因者，謂由先起忿恨心故，如是復起覆、誑、諂、嫉、慳、無慚無愧、不正知、見取等，及諸執著邪妄憶念。
translation: A cause of affliction is that it's the result of first arousing anger, and then it's followed by cover-up, deceit, flattery, jealousy, stinginess, lack of conscience and modesty, incorrect knowledge, mistaken views and grasping, and other attachments and mistaken recollections.

source_sentence: 以如是等諸惡因緣故，乃於師長不生恭敬尊重等心，亦復不能承事供養；由不尊敬彼師長故，即不見法；以不見法故，即於苾芻眾中不正觀察；由不正觀察故，乃興鬪諍。
translation: Because of these bad causes, they don't respect their teachers and masters, and they can't serve or make offerings to them; because they don't respect their teachers, they don't see the teaching; because they don't see the teaching, they don't correctly observe it in the crowd of monks; and because they don't correctly observe it, a fight ensues.

source_sentence: 「阿難！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 如先所說，如是等緣皆是鬪諍根本。
translation: As explained earlier, these kinds of conditions are the root of a quarrel.

source_sentence: 以此緣故，若鬪諍起時，有七種滅諍法。
translation: For this reason, when a fight arises, there are seven ways to end it.

source_sentence: 如我所說，阿難！
translation: As I've explained, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 諸有諍事，若已起、若未起悉能息滅。
translation: If there are any disputes that have arisen or have yet to arise, they can all be put to rest.

source_sentence: 何等為七？
translation: What are the seven?

source_sentence: 所謂現前毘尼，憶念毘尼，不癡毘尼，自言治，多人語，知所作，如草覆地；是為七種。
translation: These are the seven kinds: present-tense vini, remembering vini, not being fooled by vini, self-medicating, many people speaking, and knowing what's done like grass covering the ground.

source_sentence: 「云何名為現前毘尼滅諍法？
translation: "What's called the present method of stopping a debate through mindfulness and non-confusion?

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 所謂一人為一人說法毘尼，一人為二人說、一人為多人說、一人為大眾說，現前成四；二人為一人說法毘尼，二人為一人說、二人為多人說、二人為大眾說，現前成四；多人為一人說法毘尼，多人為二人說、多人為多人說、多人為大眾說，現前成四；大眾為一人說法毘尼，大眾為二人說、大眾為多人說、大眾為大眾說，現前成四。
translation: It's called the teaching of one person to one person, one person to two people, one person to many people, and one person to the masses, which is accomplished four times in the present; the teaching of two people to one person, two people to one person, two people to many people, and two people to the masses, which is accomplished four times in the present; the teaching of many people to one person, many people to two people, many people to many people, and many people to the masses, which is accomplished four times in the present; and the teaching of the masses to one person, the masses to two people, the masses to many people, and the masses to the masses, which is accomplished four times in the present.

source_sentence: 如是名為現前毘尼滅諍法。
translation: This is called the present-tense method of stopping a litigation through vini.

source_sentence: 以此法故，能令諍事而得息滅。
translation: Because of this teaching, it can bring about the cessation of a dispute.

source_sentence: 「云何名為憶念毘尼滅諍法？
translation: "What's called the method of remembering and recollecting the vini to end a dispute?

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 謂有苾芻隨犯罪已不自憶念，餘苾芻謂言：『汝犯是罪，應當憶念，於大眾中求哀大眾，作憶念毘尼。』
translation: Suppose there's a monk who doesn't remember a crime after it's been committed, and another monk says, 'Remember this crime you committed, and ask for pity from the crowd and make a memorial service for the crowd.'

source_sentence: 是苾芻即入眾中求哀大眾，作憶念毘尼。
translation: The monk then went into the crowd, begged the crowd for pity, and made a memorial service.

source_sentence: 是時大眾如大師教，與作憶念毘尼。
translation: The large crowd then did as the great teacher had taught, and they gave him a recitation.

source_sentence: 是苾芻得出罪已，息滅諍事。
translation: After he got rid of the sin, the monk put an end to the dispute.

source_sentence: 如是名為憶念毘尼滅諍法。
translation: This is called the method of remembering and recollecting vini to end a dispute.

source_sentence: 以此法故，能令諍事而得息滅。
translation: Because of this teaching, it's possible to put an argument to rest.

source_sentence: 「云何名為不癡毘尼滅諍法？
translation: "What is called the method of stopping a litigation by recollection of memory and memorizing vini?

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 謂若苾芻癡狂心亂、痛惱所纏，雖復多聞不能順行，於所聞法翻謂雜說，作是言已捨眾而去。
translation: Suppose a monk becomes deluded, mentally disturbed, and afflicted, and even though he's well-versed, he doesn't practice what he's heard and refers to it as miscellaneous teaching, and after saying this, he leaves the group and goes away.

source_sentence: 是苾芻，後時還得本心，餘苾芻謂言：『汝犯是罪，當入眾中求哀大眾，作不癡毘尼。』
translation: When that monk later returns to his original mind, the other monks say, 'You've committed this offense; go into the congregation, ask for pity for the people, and make a vini for not being deluded.'

source_sentence: 是苾芻即入眾中求哀大眾，作不癡毘尼。
translation: The monk then went into the crowd, begged the crowd for pity, and made the nonconfusion viniṣṇa.

source_sentence: 是時大眾如大師教，與作不癡毘尼。
translation: The large crowd then did as the great teacher had taught, and they gave him the viniṣya of not being fooled.

source_sentence: 是苾芻得出罪已，息滅諍事。
translation: After he got over his crime, the monk stopped the dispute.

source_sentence: 如是名為不癡毘尼滅諍法。
translation: This is called the method of nondelusion and vinaya for ending arguments.

source_sentence: 以此法故，能令諍事而得息滅。
translation: Because of this teaching, it's possible to put an argument to rest.

source_sentence: 「云何名為自言治滅諍法？
translation: "What's called the method of calming and extinguishing a debate by one's own words?

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 謂若苾芻不知罪相，言廣知廣解，復於眾中發如是言：『尊者！
translation: Suppose a monk doesn't know the characteristics of a sin and says he knows and understands them in detail and then says this among the people, 'Venerable!

source_sentence: 我於利養難所得故。』
translation: It's because it's difficult for me to get support.'

source_sentence: 餘苾芻謂言：『汝於罪相不知不解，言廣知廣解，汝犯是罪，當於眾中求哀大眾，悔謝其罪。』
translation: The other monks said, 'You don't know or understand the nature of sins, and you say you know and understand them in detail; you've committed this sin; go among the people, ask for their pity, and repent of your sins.'

source_sentence: 是苾芻即入眾中，求哀大眾而自悔責。
translation: The monk then went into the crowd, asked for the compassion of the crowd, and repented.

source_sentence: 是時大眾如大師教，與自言治法。
translation: The large crowd then spoke the corrective words to him, just as the great teacher had taught them.

source_sentence: 是苾芻得出罪已，息滅諍事。
translation: After he concluded his crime, the monk put an end to the dispute.

source_sentence: 如是名為自言治滅諍法。
translation: This is called the method of self-talk that quells a dispute.

source_sentence: 以此法故，能令諍事而得息滅。
translation: Because of this teaching, it's possible to put an argument to rest.

source_sentence: 「云何名為多人語滅諍法？
translation: "What's called the method of killing a litigation by multiple speakers?

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 謂若二苾芻共一住處，諍事忽起，出種種語廣興諍論，各執一言，有言是法、有言非法，有言是毘尼、有言非毘尼，有言是有罪、有言非有罪。
translation: Suppose two monks living together in the same dwelling place suddenly get into a debate and speak variously and extensively about it, each holding to a single statement, some saying it's the teaching, some saying it's not, some saying it's vini, some saying it's not vini, and some saying it's a sin and some saying it's not.

source_sentence: 是二苾芻，諍事起時息滅者善。
translation: It's good for these two monks to stop the argument when it arises.

source_sentence: 若不息滅，此二苾芻離本住處異處興諍。
translation: If they don't put an end to it, these two monks will leave their original abode and start a dispute in a different place.

source_sentence: 離是處已，能於中路息滅者善。
translation: Once they leave that place, it's good if they can put an end to it in the middle.

source_sentence: 若不息滅，即多苾芻眾共為滅諍：有以經為分別說者，有以律為分別說者，有以摩怛里迦為分別說者。
translation: If they don't put an end to it, then many monks will work together to settle the dispute: some who discern it on the basis of the sūtras, some who discern it on the basis of the vinaya, and some who discern it on the basis of the mātṛkā.

source_sentence: 以是多人為分別說故，是二苾芻諍事息滅。
translation: Because many people speak discriminatingly, these two monks will put an end to their dispute.

source_sentence: 如是名為多人語滅諍法。
translation: This is called the method of many people speaking to end a dispute.

source_sentence: 以此法故，能令諍事而得息滅。
translation: Because of this teaching, they can bring about the cessation of the dispute.

source_sentence: 「云何名為知所作滅諍法？
translation: "What's called the method of knowing what's done to end a dispute?

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 謂若苾芻隨犯罪已，自知有犯，或語他人、或不語人，而自思念已，詣餘苾芻所，脫去革屣，於苾芻前偏袒一肩右膝著地，三稱己名及自族氏：『我犯是罪不敢覆藏，來尊者所求哀懺悔。
translation: Suppose a monk follows a sin, knows he's committed it, and either says something to another person or doesn't say anything to another person; after he thinks about it, he goes to another monk, takes off his leather sandals, bares one shoulder and puts his right knee on the ground in front of the monk, and calls his name and his clan three times, "I've committed this sin and dare not hide it, so I've come to the Bhagavān to ask for pity and repentance.

source_sentence: 唯願尊者布施歡喜。』
translation: Please grant me the honor and rejoice, Venerable.'

source_sentence: 時彼尊者即聽懺悔。
translation: The Bhagavān then listened to his repentance.

source_sentence: 是苾芻得清淨已，彼尊者言：『汝見是罪相不？』
translation: After that monk attained purity, the venerable said, 'Do you see the marks of this offense?'

source_sentence: 苾芻答言：『我已見是罪相。』
translation: The monk replied, 'I've seen this mark of guilt.'

source_sentence: 尊者復言：『汝當如法奉持律儀。』
translation: The Venerable again said, 'You must observe the precepts according to the teaching.'

source_sentence: 苾芻答言：『我今如法奉持律儀。』
translation: The monk answered, 'Now, I will observe the precepts according to the teaching.'

source_sentence: 如是三說。
translation: He explained it this way three times.

source_sentence: 如是名為知所作滅諍法。
translation: This is called the method of knowing what's done to end a dispute.

source_sentence: 以此法故，能令諍事而得息滅。
translation: Because of this teaching, it's possible to bring about the cessation of a dispute.

source_sentence: 「云何名為如草覆地滅諍法？
translation: "What's called the method of stopping a dispute like covering the ground with grass?

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 謂諸苾芻眾共在一處，互起鬪諍分兩朋住。
translation: It means a group of monks are all together in one place, and they get into a fight with each other and live in two groups.

source_sentence: 時一朋中，耆年者耆年者一處，知法者知法者一處，上首者上首者一處。
translation: In one group, there's one place for those who are elderly, one place for those who know the teaching, and one place for those who are the most senior.

source_sentence: 於是朋中有苾芻，為利養故而起諍事。
translation: Then, there was a monk in that group who started a quarrel for the sake of making a living.

source_sentence: 起諍事已，於自眾中作如是言：『某處白衣舍利養易得，我於彼中如法律說。
translation: After starting the argument, he says this among his own group, 'There's a place where it's easy to get a profit from a white robe, and I explain it according to the Dharma among them.'

source_sentence: 有餘苾芻，以是緣故於我起諍。
translation: It's for this reason that some other monk started a dispute with me.

source_sentence: 諸大德！
translation: Venerables!

source_sentence: 若我以是事故犯諍罪者，願諸大德捨我是罪，乃至我故入白衣舍亦悉聽懺除，犯突吉羅罪故。
translation: 'If I commit a contentious offense in this way, may the great virtues forgive me for it, even if I were to enter the white-robed dwelling for that reason and hear all of them confess and expunge it, for committing the sin of duṣkṛ.

source_sentence: 我從今已往不作是事，若有所作，當於諸大德所求哀懺悔，我有所作不敢覆藏。』
translation: From now on, I won't do such a thing, but if I do, I'll ask the great virtues to kindly repent, for I won't dare to hide what I've done.'

source_sentence: 是苾芻作是懺時，而自朋中唯一苾芻不聽許懺。
translation: When that monk made this confession, the only monk among his friends wouldn't allow it.

source_sentence: 時彼苾芻即入他朋，脫去革屣偏袒一肩，從耆年上座次第問訊已，還至上座前右膝著地合掌而住，即白眾言：『諸大德！
translation: That monk then went into the company of others, took off his leather sandals, bared one shoulder, and went from the elder monk to the elder monk's seat, exchanged greetings with him, returned to the seat, knelt on his right knee, put his palms together, and said, 'Great masters!

source_sentence: 某處白衣舍利養易得，我於彼中如法律說。
translation: "There's a place where it's easy to obtain a white-robed bundle of joy, and I explain it there according to the Dharma.

source_sentence: 有餘苾芻，以是緣故於我起諍。
translation: Some other monks, for that reason, started a dispute with me.

source_sentence: 我即於自眾中如法求懺，時我眾中有一苾芻不聽許懺，我故來此求哀懺悔。
translation: I then asked for repentance in accordance with the Dharma among my own group, and there was one monk among my group who didn't accept the repentance, so I came here to ask for pity and repentance.

source_sentence: 諸大德！
translation: Great masters!

source_sentence: 若我以是事故犯諍罪者，願諸大德捨我是罪，乃至我從白衣舍出，亦悉聽懺除，犯突吉羅罪故。
translation: 'If I have committed a contentious offense in this way, may the great virtues forgive me for it, even if I were to come out of the white-robed abode and be heard to repent and be excused for committing the sin of tukhila.

source_sentence: 我今於諸大德前求哀懺悔，我有所作不敢覆藏，願諸大德聽許我懺，布施歡喜。』
translation: Now, I'd like to beg you all to kindly repent before the great masters, for I dare not conceal what I've done, so may you grant me repentance and rejoice in generosity.'

source_sentence: 時彼大眾即聽許懺。
translation: The crowd then agreed to allow the repentance.

source_sentence: 是苾芻得清淨已，彼上座謂言：『汝見是罪相不？』
translation: After that monk attained purity, the elder monk said, 'Do you see this mark of guilt?'

source_sentence: 苾芻答言：『我已見是罪相。』
translation: The monk replied, 'I've seen this mark of guilt.'

source_sentence: 彼上座復言：『汝當如法奉持律儀。』
translation: The superior monk then replied, 'You must observe the precepts according to the teaching.'

source_sentence: 苾芻答言：『我今如法奉持律儀。』
translation: The monk replied, 'Now, I will observe the precepts according to the teaching.'

source_sentence: 如是三說。
translation: He said this three times.

source_sentence: 時他朋中亦如此朋，耆年者耆年者一處，知法者知法者一處，上首者上首者一處。
translation: Among those other friends, there was also this friend, a senior who was senior in one place, a knower of the teaching who knew the teaching in one place, and a superior who was superior in one place.

source_sentence: 於是朋中有苾芻為利養故而起諍事。
translation: Among those friends, there were monks who started a dispute for the sake of making a profit.

source_sentence: 起諍事已，於自眾中作如是言：『某白衣舍利養易得，我於彼中如法律說。
translation: After starting the quarrel, he says this among his own group, 'A certain white man's donation is easy to obtain, and I explain it according to the Dharma among them.'

source_sentence: 有餘苾芻，以是緣故起鬪諍事。』
translation: There are other monks who, for this reason, have started a quarrel.'

source_sentence: 如是乃至第二第三問答等事，廣如前說。
translation: This and the second and third questions and answers are explained in detail as before.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 彼彼苾芻知自有犯往來陳懺已，互相見時恭敬問訊，息滅諍緣止諸語論，無復少法而起分別。
translation: After they know they've committed a transgression and come to confess it, the monks respectfully greet each other when they see each other, quell the causes of the dispute, stop talking, and discriminate no more than a few things.

source_sentence: 如是名為如草覆地滅諍法。
translation: This is called the method of stopping a litigation like covering the ground with grass.

source_sentence: 以此法故，能令諍事而得息滅。
translation: Because of this teaching, it's possible to put an argument to rest.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 如是等七滅諍法，汝諸苾芻應當記念。
translation: These are the seven rules for ending disputes that you monks should remember.

source_sentence: 「復次，阿難！
translation: "Furthermore, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 有六種和敬法。
translation: "There are six ways to revere the Dharma.

source_sentence: 汝等諦聽，如理作意，如善記念，今為汝說。
translation: All of you listen closely, contemplate them according to reason, and remember them well as I explain them for you.

source_sentence: 何等為六？
translation: What are the six?

source_sentence: 所謂於其身業行慈和事，常於佛所淨修梵行，於諸正法尊重禮敬、如理修行，於苾芻眾和合共住，此名身業和敬法。
translation: This is called the method of harmonizing physical actions by performing acts of kindness and harmony, always purifying the religious practice in the Buddha's place, honoring and venerating the right principles, and correctly cultivating them, and living in harmony with the congregation of monks.

source_sentence: 復於語業，出慈和語無諸違諍，此名語業和敬法。
translation: Furthermore, in the action of speech, he produces kind and peaceful speech without conflict, which is called the peaceful and respectful action of speech.

source_sentence: 復於意業，起慈和意無所違背，此名意業和敬法。
translation: Furthermore, when it comes to mental activity, it generates kindness and a harmonious mind without any conflict, which is called the peaceful and respectful method of mental activity.

source_sentence: 又復，若得法利及世利養悉同所受，或時持鉢次第行乞，隨有所得飲食等物白眾令知，與眾同受勿私隱用，若眾同知者即同梵行，此名利和敬法。
translation: Furthermore, if he attains the benefits of the Dharma and worldly benefits, he'll all receive them together, or if he takes a bowl and goes begging in order, he'll tell the people that he's gotten food and drink and other things, and he'll accept them together and not use them privately; if the people know this together, they'll be practicing the same celibacy, which is called the method of making benefits and honoring others.

source_sentence: 又復於戒不破不斷，戒力堅固離垢清淨已，知時知處普徧平等，應受施主飲食供養，如是淨戒同一所修、同所了知、同修梵行，此名戒和敬法。
translation: Furthermore, when the precepts are not broken or unremitted, their strength is resolute, they are spotless and pure, and they know when and where to accept offerings of food and drink from the donor with universal equality.

source_sentence: 又復若見聖智趣證出離之道，乃至盡苦邊際，於如是相如實見已，同一所作、同所了知、同修梵行，此名見和敬法。
translation: Furthermore, if someone sees the noble wisdom that leads to the realization of the path to escape ... to the end of suffering, and after truly seeing such characteristics, they work together, comprehend them together, and cultivate the religious practice together, this is called the method of seeing and honoring.

source_sentence: 如是等名為六和敬法。
translation: Such and so forth are called the six rules of reverence.

source_sentence: 「阿難！
translation: "Ānanda!

source_sentence: 如先所說鬪諍根本，汝諸苾芻應當斷除，於七滅諍法應當了知，諸有諍事若已起、若未起，悉令息滅已，同修六和敬法。
translation: As explained earlier, you monks should stop the root of your quarrels, understand the seven rules for ending quarrels, and cause all quarrels, whether they have arisen or not, to cease, and then cultivate the six rules of harmony and respect together.

source_sentence: 汝諸苾芻！
translation: You monks!

source_sentence: 若如是行，乃於東西南北，隨往方所若行若止，令汝苾芻悉得安樂、離諸諍事；乃至我涅槃後，亦復令汝諸苾芻眾，於一切處常得安樂，如我現在住世說法教化眾生等無有異。」
translation: If you thus conduct yourself, then you will go from east to west, from north to south, and from place to place, whether it's walking or stopping, so that you monks will all be comfortable and free from disputes; even after I pass away, I will cause you monks and nuns to always be comfortable in all places, just as I am now living in the world teaching and transforming sentient beings, without any difference."

source_sentence: 佛說息諍因緣經
translation: Sutra on the Causes and Conditions for Relieving Strife
